oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard from a German prisoner of war camp
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Prisoner of War Pvt. Louis Hanson, West Yorkshire Infantry Regiment, addressed this postcard to Mrs. L. Yates in Huddersfield, England. It passed the censor on October 14, 1918. The camp is identified as Friedrichfeld, Wesel, Westphalia [North Rhine- Westphalia]. Louis reports that he is alright, and requests his mother to send some cheap hard biscuits, St. Ivel cheese, a toothbrush, "and for Heaven's sake don't forget eggs," "4 months without a Gold Flake." Gold Flake was a brand of cigarettes.
